message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper proposes a model for detecting cross-lingual plagiarism (CLP) using simulated word embeddings. The paper focuses on natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques for detecting plagiarism, which are typically covered in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for comparing large documents, which is covered in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. The use of word embeddings and machine learning models for detecting plagiarism falls under the cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves multi-lingual NLP techniques, which could be covered in the cs.CY (Computing and Language) sub-category. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL, followed by cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.CY.
